member.name: T:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel
member.summary:
Represents a tax rule that changes the behavior of Avalara's tax engine for certain products and/or entity use codes in certain jurisdictions.
Avalara supports a few different types of tax rules. For information about tax rule types, see [TaxRuleTypeId](https://developer.avalara.com/api-reference/avatax/rest/v2/models/enums/TaxRuleTypeId/)
Because different types of tax rules have different behavior, some fields may change their behavior based on the type of tax rule selected. Please read the documentation for each field carefully and ensure that the value you send is appropriate for the type of tax rule.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.id
member.summary: The unique ID number of this tax rule.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.companyId
member.summary: The unique ID number of the company that owns this tax rule.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.taxCodeId
member.summary:
For rules that apply to a specific tax code only, this specifies which tax code is affected by this rule.
You can choose to specify a tax code either by passing its unique ID number in the `taxCodeId` field or by passing its alphanumeric code in the `taxCode` field. To search for the appropriate tax code for your custom rule, use the `ListTaxCodes` API.
The `RateOverrideRule`, `BaseRule`, and `ExemptEntityRule` rule types can be applied to all tax codes. To make a rule that applies to all tax codes, leave both fields blank.
The `ProductTaxabilityRule` rule must be associated with a tax code. If you attempt to create a product taxability rule without a tax code, you will get an error message.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.taxCode
member.summary:
For rules that apply to a specific tax code only, this specifies which tax code is affected by this rule.
You can choose to specify a tax code either by passing its unique ID number in the `taxCodeId` field or by passing its alphanumeric code in the `taxCode` field. To search for the appropriate tax code for your custom rule, use the `ListTaxCodes` API.
The `RateOverrideRule`, `BaseRule`, and `ExemptEntityRule` rule types can be applied to all tax codes. To make a rule that applies to all tax codes, leave both fields blank.
The `ProductTaxabilityRule` rule must be associated with a tax code. If you attempt to create a product taxability rule without a tax code, you will get an error message.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.stateFIPS
member.summary:
For U.S. tax rules, this is the state's Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) code.
This field is required for rules that apply to specific jurisdictions in the United States. It is not required if you set the `isAllJuris` flag to true.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.jurisName
member.summary:
The name of the jurisdiction to which this tax rule applies.
Custom tax rules can apply to a specific jurisdiction or to all jurisdictions. To select a jurisdiction, use the [ListJurisdictions API](https://developer.avalara.com/api-reference/avatax/rest/v2/methods/Definitions/ListJurisdictions/) or the [ListJurisdictionsByAddress API](https://developer.avalara.com/api-reference/avatax/rest/v2/methods/Definitions/ListJurisdictionsByAddress/). To set a rule that applies to all jurisdictions of a specific type, see `isAllJuris`.
Once you have determined which jurisdiction you wish to assign to the tax rule, you should fill in the `jurisName`, `jurisCode`, and `jurisdictionTypeId` fields using the information you retrieved from the API above.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.jurisCode
member.summary:
The code of the jurisdiction to which this tax rule applies.
Custom tax rules can apply to a specific jurisdiction or to all jurisdictions. To select a jurisdiction, use the [ListJurisdictions API](https://developer.avalara.com/api-reference/avatax/rest/v2/methods/Definitions/ListJurisdictions/) or the [ListJurisdictionsByAddress API](https://developer.avalara.com/api-reference/avatax/rest/v2/methods/Definitions/ListJurisdictionsByAddress/).
Once you have determined which jurisdiction you wish to assign to the tax rule, you should fill in the `jurisName`, `jurisCode`, and `jurisdictionTypeId` fields using the information you retrieved from the API above.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.jurisTypeId
member.summary: DEPRECATED - Date: 12/20/2017, Version: 18.1, Message: Please use `jurisdictionTypeId` instead.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.jurisdictionTypeId
member.summary:
The type of the jurisdiction to which this tax rule applies.
Custom tax rules can apply to a specific jurisdiction or to all jurisdictions. To select a jurisdiction, use the [ListJurisdictions API](https://developer.avalara.com/api-reference/avatax/rest/v2/methods/Definitions/ListJurisdictions/) or the [ListJurisdictionsByAddress API](https://developer.avalara.com/api-reference/avatax/rest/v2/methods/Definitions/ListJurisdictionsByAddress/).
Once you have determined which jurisdiction you wish to assign to the tax rule, you should fill in the `jurisName`, `jurisCode`, and `jurisdictionTypeId` fields using the information you retrieved from the API above.
To make a custom tax rule for US or Canada that applies to all jurisdictions of a specific type, see the `isAllJuris` field for more information.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.customerUsageType
member.summary: DEPRECATED - Date: 10/16/2017, Version: 17.11, Message: Please use `entityUseCode` instead.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.entityUseCode
member.summary:
The entity use code to which this rule applies.
You can create custom `entityUseCode` values with specific behavior using this API, or you can change the behavior of Avalara's system-defined entity use codes.
For a full list of Avalara-defined entity use codes, see the [ListEntityUseCodes API](https://developer.avalara.com/api-reference/avatax/rest/v2/methods/Definitions/ListEntityUseCodes/).

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.taxTypeId
member.summary:
Some tax type groups contain multiple different types of tax. To create a rule that affects only one type of tax within a tax type group, set this value to the code matching the specific tax type within that group. The custom tax rule will then only apply to taxes calculated for that specific type.
For rules that affect all tax types, use the value `A` to match `All` tax types within that group.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.rateTypeId
member.summary: DEPRECATED - Date: 8/27/2018, Version: 18.9, Message: Please use `rateTypeCode`, `taxTypeGroup` and `subTaxType` instead.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.rateTypeCode
member.summary:
Indicates the code of the rate type that applies to this rule. Use [ListRateTypesByCountry](https://developer.avalara.com/api-reference/avatax/rest/v2/methods/Definitions/ListRateTypesByCountry/) API for a full list of rate type codes.
If you specify a value in the rateTypeCode field, this rule will cause tax lines that are affected by the rule to change to a different rate type code.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.taxRuleTypeId
member.summary:
This type value determines the behavior of the tax rule.
You can specify that this rule controls the product's taxability or exempt / nontaxable status, the product's rate (for example, if you have been granted an official ruling for your product's rate that differs from the official rate), or other types of behavior.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.isAllJuris
member.summary:
Allows you to make tax rules apply to lower jurisdictions. This feature is only available in the United States and Canada.
* In the United States, this value can be used for rules written at the `State` jurisdictional level. If set to `true`, this rule will at the state level, county level, city level, and special jurisdiction level. * In Canada, this value can be used for rules written at the `Country` or `State` jurisdictional levels. If set to `true`, this rule will at all lower jurisdictional levels.
For any other use case, this value must be `false`.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.value
member.summary:
This field has different behavior based on the type of the tax rule.
* For a product taxability rule, this value is either 1 or 0, indicating taxable or non-taxable. * For a rate override rule, this value is the corrected rate stored as a decimal, for example, a rate of 5% would be stored as 0.05 decimal. If you use the special value of 1.0, only the cap and threshold values will be applied and the rate will be left alone.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.cap
member.summary:
The maximum cap for the price of this item according to this rule. Any amount above this cap will not be subject to this rule.
For example, if you must pay 5% of a product's value up to a maximum value of $1000, you would set the `cap` to `1000.00` and the `value` to `0.05`.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.threshold
member.summary:
The per-unit threshold that must be met before this rule applies.
For example, if your product is nontaxable unless it is above $100 per product, you would set the `threshold` value to `100`. In this case, the rate for the rule would apply to the entire amount above $100.
You can also create rules that make the entire product taxable if it exceeds a threshold, but is nontaxable if it is below the threshold. To choose this, set the `options` field to the value `TaxAll`.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.options
member.summary:
Supports custom options for your tax rule.
Supported options include: * `TaxAll` - This value indicates that the entire amount of the line becomes taxable when the line amount exceeds the `threshold`.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.effectiveDate
member.summary: The first date at which this rule applies. If `null`, this rule will apply to all dates prior to the end date.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.endDate
member.summary: The last date for which this rule applies. If `null`, this rule will apply to all dates after the effective date.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.description
member.summary: A friendly name for this tax rule.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.countyFIPS
member.summary:
For U.S. tax rules, this is the county's Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) code.
This field is required for rules that apply to specific jurisdictions in the United States. It is not required if you set the `isAllJuris` flag to true.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.isSTPro
member.summary: DEPRECATED - Date: 8/27/2018, Version: 18.9, Message: This field is no longer required.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.country
member.summary:
Name or ISO 3166 code identifying the country where this rule will apply.
This field supports many different country identifiers: * Two character ISO 3166 codes * Three character ISO 3166 codes * Fully spelled out names of the country in ISO supported languages * Common alternative spellings for many countries
For a full list of all supported codes and names, please see the Definitions API `ListCountries`.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.region
member.summary:
Name or ISO 3166 code identifying the region where this rule will apply.
This field supports many different region identifiers: * Two and three character ISO 3166 region codes * Fully spelled out names of the region in ISO supported languages * Common alternative spellings for many regions
For a full list of all supported codes and names, please see the Definitions API `ListRegions`. NOTE: Region is required for US and not required for non-US countries because the user may be either creating a Country-level or Region-level rule.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.sourcing
member.summary: The sourcing types to which this rule applies.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.taxTypeGroup
member.summary:
This field has different behavior based on the type of rule.
* For a product taxability rule, if the rule applies to an item, this value will override the tax type group of the original product. * For other rules, this value determines what tax type groups will be affected by the rule.
Refer to `ListTaxTypeGroups` for a list of tax type groups supported by AvaTax.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.taxSubType
member.summary:
This field has different behavior based on the type of rule.
* For a product taxability rule, if the rule applies to an item, this value will override the tax sub type of the original product. * For other rules, this value determines what tax sub types will be affected by the rule.
Refer to `ListTaxSubtypes` for a list of tax sub types supported by AvaTax.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.nonPassthroughExpression
member.summary: Reserved for Avalara internal usage. Leave this field null.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.currencyCode
member.summary:
The currency code to use for this rule.
For a list of currencies supported by AvaTax, use the [ListCurrencies API](https://developer.avalara.com/api-reference/avatax/rest/v2/methods/Definitions/ListCurrencies/).

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.preferredProgramId
member.summary: Reserved for Avalara internal usage. Leave this field null.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TaxRuleModel.uomId
member.summary:
For tax rules that are calculated using units of measurement, this indicates the unit of measurement type used to calculate the amounts for this rule.
For a list of units of measurement, use the [ListUnitsOfMeasurement API](https://developer.avalara.com/api-reference/avatax/rest/v2/methods/Definitions/ListUnitOfMeasurement/).

member.summary: The line number or code indicating the line on this invoice or receipt or document.

member.summary: The unique ID number of the boundary override applied to this line item.

member.summary: DEPRECATED - Date: 10/16/2017, Version: 17.11, Message: Please use entityUseCode instead. The customer usage type for this line item. Usage type often affects taxability rules.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.entityUseCode
member.summary: The entity use code for this line item. Usage type often affects taxability rules.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.description
member.summary: A description of the item or service represented by this line.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.destinationAddressId
member.summary: The unique ID number of the destination address where this line was delivered or sold. In the case of a point-of-sale transaction, the destination address and origin address will be the same. In the case of a shipped transaction, they will be different.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.originAddressId
member.summary: The unique ID number of the origin address where this line was delivered or sold. In the case of a point-of-sale transaction, the origin address and destination address will be the same. In the case of a shipped transaction, they will be different.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.discountAmount
member.summary: The amount of discount that was applied to this line item. This represents the difference between list price and sale price of the item. In general, a discount represents money that did not change hands; tax is calculated on only the amount of money that changed hands.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.discountTypeId
member.summary: The type of discount, if any, that was applied to this line item.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.exemptAmount
member.summary: The amount of this line item that was exempt.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.exemptCertId
member.summary: The unique ID number of the exemption certificate that applied to this line item. It is the calc_id associated with a certificate in CertCapture.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.certificateId
member.summary: The CertCapture Certificate ID

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.exemptNo
member.summary: The customer Tax Id Number (tax_number) associated with a certificate - Sales tax calculation requests first determine if there is an applicable ECMS entry available, and will utilize it for exemption processing. If no applicable ECMS entry is available, the AvaTax service will determine if an Exemption Number field is populated or an Entity/Use Code is included in the sales tax calculation request, and will perform exemption processing using either of those two options.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.isItemTaxable
member.summary: True if this item is taxable.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.isSSTP
member.summary: True if this item is a Streamlined Sales Tax line item.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.itemCode
member.summary: The code string of the item represented by this line item.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.lineAmount
member.summary: The total amount of the transaction, including both taxable and exempt. This is the total price for all items. To determine the individual item price, divide this by quantity.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.quantity
member.summary: The quantity of products sold on this line item.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.ref1
member.summary: A user-defined reference identifier for this transaction line item.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.ref2
member.summary: A user-defined reference identifier for this transaction line item.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.reportingDate
member.summary: The date when this transaction should be reported. By default, all transactions are reported on the date when the actual transaction took place. In some cases, line items may be reported later due to delayed shipments or other business reasons.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.revAccount
member.summary: The revenue account number for this line item.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.sourcing
member.summary: Indicates whether this line item was taxed according to the origin or destination.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.tax
member.summary:
The tax for this line in this transaction.
If you used a `taxOverride` of type `taxAmount` for this line, this value will represent the amount of your override. AvaTax will still attempt to calculate the correct tax for this line and will store that calculated value in the `taxCalculated` field.
You can compare the `tax` and `taxCalculated` fields to check for any discrepancies between an external tax calculation provider and the calculation performed by AvaTax.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.taxableAmount
member.summary: The taxable amount of this line item.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.taxCalculated
member.summary:
The amount of tax that AvaTax calculated for the transaction.
If you used a `taxOverride` of type `taxAmount`, there may be a difference between the `tax` field which applies your override, and the `taxCalculated` field which represents the amount of tax that AvaTax calculated without the override.
You can compare the `tax` and `taxCalculated` fields to check for any discrepancies between an external tax calculation provider and the calculation performed by AvaTax.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.taxCode
member.summary: The code string for the tax code that was used to calculate this line item.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.taxCodeId
member.summary: The unique ID number for the tax code that was used to calculate this line item.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.taxDate
member.summary: The date that was used for calculating tax amounts for this line item. By default, this date should be the same as the document date. In some cases, for example when a consumer returns a product purchased previously, line items may be calculated using a tax date in the past so that the consumer can receive a refund for the correct tax amount that was charged when the item was originally purchased.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.taxEngine
member.summary: The tax engine identifier that was used to calculate this line item.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.taxOverrideType
member.summary: If a tax override was specified, this indicates the type of tax override.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.businessIdentificationNo
member.summary: VAT business identification number used for this transaction.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.taxOverrideAmount
member.summary: If a tax override was specified, this indicates the amount of tax that was requested.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.taxOverrideReason
member.summary: If a tax override was specified, represents the reason for the tax override.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.taxIncluded
member.summary:
Indicates whether the `amount` for this line already includes tax.
If this value is `true`, the final price of this line including tax will equal the value in `amount`.
If this value is `null` or `false`, the final price will equal `amount` plus whatever taxes apply to this line.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.details
member.summary:
Optional: A list of tax details for this line item.
Tax details represent taxes being charged by various tax authorities. Taxes that appear in the `details` collection are intended to be displayed to the customer and charged as a 'tax' on the invoice.
To fetch this list, add the query string `?$include=Details` to your URL.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.nonPassthroughDetails
member.summary:
Optional: A list of non-passthrough tax details for this line item.
Tax details represent taxes being charged by various tax authorities. Taxes that appear in the `nonPassthroughDetails` collection are taxes that must be paid directly by the company and not shown to the customer.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.lineLocationTypes
member.summary: Optional: A list of location types for this line item. To fetch this list, add the query string "?$include=LineLocationTypes" to your URL.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionLineModel.parameters
member.summary: Contains a list of extra parameters that were set when the transaction was created.

member.summary: DEPRECATED - Date: 07/25/2018, Version: 18.7, Message: This field is deprecated and will return null till its removed. The date when payment was made on this transaction. By default, this should be the same as the date of the transaction.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.status
member.summary: The status of the transaction.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.type
member.summary:
The type of the transaction.
Transactions of type `SalesOrder`, `ReturnOrder`, and so on are temporary estimates and will not be saved.
Transactions of type `SalesInvoice, `ReturnInvoice`, and so on are permanent transactions that can be reported to tax authorities if they are in status `Committed`.
A sales transaction represents a sale from the company to a customer. A purchase transaction represents a purchase made by the company. A return transaction represents a customer who decided to request a refund after purchasing a product from the company. An inventory transfer transaction represents goods that were moved from one location of the company to another location without changing ownership.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.batchCode
member.summary: If this transaction was created as part of a batch, this code indicates which batch.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.currencyCode
member.summary: The three-character ISO 4217 currency code that was used for payment for this transaction.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.customerUsageType
member.summary: DEPRECATED - Date: 10/16/2017, Version: 17.11, Message: Please use entityUseCode instead. The customer usage type for this transaction. Customer usage types often affect exemption or taxability rules.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.entityUseCode
member.summary: The entity use code for this transaction. Entity use codes often affect exemption or taxability rules.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.customerVendorCode
member.summary: DEPRECATED - Date: 3/1/2018, Version: 18.3, Message: Please use `customerCode` This field has been renamed to `customerCode` to match documentation for other APIs related to exemption customers.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.customerCode
member.summary:
Unique code identifying the customer that requested this transaction.
When you specify a `customerCode`, AvaTax will look to see if a customer exists with this code in the exemption certificate system. If that customer exists, and if that customer has uploaded an exemption certificate that applies to this transaction, the relevant parts of this transaction that can use the exemption certificate will be treated as exempt.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.exemptNo
member.summary: The customer Tax Id Number (tax_number) associated with a certificate - Sales tax calculation requests first determine if there is an applicable ECMS entry available, and will utilize it for exemption processing. If no applicable ECMS entry is available, the AvaTax service will determine if an Exemption Number field is populated or an Entity/Use Code is included in the sales tax calculation request, and will perform exemption processing using either of those two options.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.reconciled
member.summary: If this transaction has been reconciled against the company's ledger, this value is set to true.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.locationCode
member.summary: DEPRECATED - Date: 3/1/2018, Version: 18.3, Message: In order to ensure consistency of field names, Please use reportingLocationCode instead. This field has been replaced by the reportingLocationCode field

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.reportingLocationCode
member.summary:
For customers who use [location-based tax reporting](https://developer.avalara.com/avatax/dev-guide/locations/location-based-reporting), this field controls how this transaction will be filed for multi-location tax filings.
If you specify a non-null value for this field, AvaTax will ensure that this transaction is reported on the tax return associated with the [LocationModel](https://developer.avalara.com/api-reference/avatax/rest/v2/models/LocationModel/) identified by this code.
This field does not affect any addresses for the transaction. It only controls the tax filing behavior of this transaction.
If you are looking for information about how to set up addresses for a transaction, please see [Using Address Types](https://developer.avalara.com/avatax/dev-guide/customizing-transaction/address-types/) in the AvaTax Developer Guide.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.purchaseOrderNo
member.summary: The customer-supplied purchase order number of this transaction.

member.summary: A user-defined reference code for this transaction.

member.summary: The salesperson who provided this transaction. Not required.

member.summary: If a tax override was applied to this transaction, indicates what type of tax override was applied.

member.summary: If a tax override was applied to this transaction, indicates the amount of tax that was requested by the customer.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.taxOverrideReason
member.summary: If a tax override was applied to this transaction, indicates the reason for the tax override.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.totalAmount
member.summary: The total amount of this transaction.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.totalExempt
member.summary: The amount of this transaction that was exempt.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.totalDiscount
member.summary: The total amount of discounts applied to all lines within this transaction.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.totalTax
member.summary:
The total tax for all lines in this transaction.
If you used a `taxOverride` of type `taxAmount` for any lines in this transaction, this value may be different than the amount of tax calculated by AvaTax. The amount of tax calculated by AvaTax will be stored in the `totalTaxCalculated` field, whereas this field will contain the total tax that was charged on the transaction.
You can compare the `totalTax` and `totalTaxCalculated` fields to check for any discrepancies between an external tax calculation provider and the calculation performed by AvaTax.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.totalTaxable
member.summary: The portion of the total amount of this transaction that was taxable.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.totalTaxCalculated
member.summary:
The amount of tax that AvaTax calculated for the transaction.
If you used a `taxOverride` of type `taxAmount` for any lines in this transaction, this value will represent the amount that AvaTax calculated for this transaction without applying the override. The field `totalTax` will be the total amount of tax after all overrides are applied.
You can compare the `totalTax` and `totalTaxCalculated` fields to check for any discrepancies between an external tax calculation provider and the calculation performed by AvaTax.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.TransactionModel.isSellerImporterOfRecord
member.summary:
By default, the value is null, when the value is null, the value can be set at nexus level and used. If the value is not null, it will override the value at nexus level.
If true, this seller was considered the importer of record of a product shipped internationally.
If this transaction is not an international transaction, this field may be left blank.
The "importer of record" is liable to pay customs and import duties for products shipped internationally. If you specify that the seller is the importer of record, then estimates of customs and import duties will be added as tax details to the transaction. Otherwise, the buyer is considered the importer of record, and customs and import duties will not be added to the tax details for this transaction.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.ValidatedAddressInfo.region
member.summary:
Name or ISO 3166 code identifying the region within the country.
This field supports many different region identifiers: * Two and three character ISO 3166 region codes * Fully spelled out names of the region in ISO supported languages * Common alternative spellings for many regions
For a full list of all supported codes and names, please see the Definitions API `ListRegions`.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.ValidatedAddressInfo.country
member.summary:
Name or ISO 3166 code identifying the country.
This field supports many different country identifiers: * Two character ISO 3166 codes * Three character ISO 3166 codes * Fully spelled out names of the country in ISO supported languages * Common alternative spellings for many countries
For a full list of all supported codes and names, please see the Definitions API `ListCountries`.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.ValidatedAddressInfo.postalCode
member.summary: Postal Code / Zip Code component of the address.

member.name: T:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.VerifyMultiDocumentModel
member.summary:
Verify that a MultiDocument object matches the information in your accounting system.
If all attributes of the MultiDocument object match the values in your request, the MultiDocument object will be moved to the document status `Posted`.
For more information on document status, see [DocumentStatus](https://developer.avalara.com/api-reference/avatax/rest/v2/models/enums/DocumentStatus/).

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.VerifyMultiDocumentModel.code
member.summary:
Represents the unique code of this MultiDocument transaction.
A MultiDocument transaction is uniquely identified by its `accountId`, `code`, and `type`.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.VerifyMultiDocumentModel.type
member.summary:
Represents the document type of this MultiDocument transaction. For more information about document types, see [DocumentType](https://developer.avalara.com/api-reference/avatax/rest/v2/models/enums/DocumentType/).
A MultiDocument transaction is uniquely identified by its `accountId`, `code`, and `type`.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.VerifyMultiDocumentModel.verifyTransactionDate
member.summary:
Set this value if you wish to verify a match between `verifyTransactionDate` and the `documentDate` value on the transaction recorded in AvaTax.
If you leave this field empty, we will skip verification for this field.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.VerifyMultiDocumentModel.verifyTotalAmount
member.summary:
Set this value if you wish to verify a match between `verifyTotalAmount` and the `totalAmount` value on the transaction recorded in AvaTax.
If you leave this field empty, we will skip verification for this field.

member.summary:

member.summary: Convert this object to a JSON string of itself
member.returns: A JSON string of this object

member.name: T:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.VerifyTransactionModel
member.summary:
Verify this transaction by matching it to values in your accounting system.
You may specify one or more of the following fields to verify: `date`, `totalAmount`, or `totalTax`. This call will report an error if there is any difference between the data stored in AvaTax and the data stored in your accounting system.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.VerifyTransactionModel.verifyTransactionDate
member.summary:
Set this value if you wish to verify a match between `verifyTransactionDate` and the `documentDate` value on the transaction recorded in AvaTax.
If you leave this field empty, we will skip verification for this field.

member.name: P:Avalara.AvaTax.RestClient.VerifyTransactionModel.verifyTotalAmount
member.summary:
Set this value if you wish to verify a match between `verifyTotalAmount` and the `totalAmount` value on the transaction recorded in AvaTax.
If you leave this field empty, we will skip verification for this field.
